City Council

6:30 p.m. Third Tuesday of each month City Hall 491 Avenue Poteet , TX 78065 Please check the bulletin board in front of City Hall for posted Agendas and Updates. Agendas are available prior to the meetings. Minutes are available following approval. Most Recent Agenda | View All Agendas and Minutes

  • Denise Leal Sanchez, Mayor 830-742-2983 mayor@poteettexas.gov

The Mayor's Office is located in City Hall. Please keep in mind the Mayoral position is not a full-time employee and does not keep regular office hours.  It is recommended that an appointment be made to speak with the Mayor.  A voicemail can be left at (830) 742-3574

Our Mayor and City Councilmembers have city-issued cellphones for your convenience.

  • Nicholas Sanchez, Councilmember Place 1 830-276-1353 nsanchez@poteettexas.gov
  • Henry Dominguez,  Councilmember Place 2 830-742-2646 hdominguez@poteettexas.gov
  • Jeremy Fernandez, Councilmember Place 3 830-783-7772 jfernandez@poteettexas.gov
  • Vanessa Saylor, Councilmember Place 4 830-742-2423 vsaylor@poteettexas.gov
  • Crystal Bautista, Mayor Pro Tem Place 5 830-276-0977 cbautista@poteettexas.gov
All governing body members serve two-year terms. The governing body, being the elected representative of the people, adopts all ordinances and resolutions and determines the general goals and policies.

CITY COUNCIL INFORMATION:

The City of Poteet holds its Regular Scheduled City Council Meeting the third (3 ) Tuesday of each month at 6:30 P.M.  If you have an item that you would like placed on the next Regularly Scheduled City Council Meeting please submit this form , to the City Secretary no later than 5:00 P.M. the Tuesday before the scheduled meeting.  When submitting an agenda item request form, please be as detailed as possible as to what it is you are asking from the Mayor and Council, and please specify whether and Action needs to be taken.  All citizen agendas must be approved by the Mayor before a citizen's agenda will be placed on the council's agenda.

Residents, business owners and visitors attending City Council meetings please become familiar with following Texas Penal Code violations:

If you would like to voice your concerns, there is a 3-minute limit for each person to speak to the Council at the beginning of each Regularly Scheduled Meeting. You MUST fill out a Speaker Card and submit it to the City Secretary PRIOR to the start of the meeting. Due to legal requirements, Council cannot take specific action on Citizens’ Comments which are not included in the agenda, They will hear your comments and Council may:

If you would like to file a Public Information Request, please fill out this form , and submit it to the Deputy City Secretary via email afrautschi@poteettexas.gov . Please note that there may be a charge for receiving a Public Information Request.
